documents.document: @MoataTamaira "fair Verona", nice and Shakespearean. Plus arguably a euphemism.
@govtgoth yup. Plus Tim's a really nice dude too, always a mellow day up there getting worked on.
@govtgoth Went to Manu originally, he told me to go to Tim (back when Tim was just setting up in Paekak). Have been going to Tim ever since.
@govtgoth eh, they're mostly black, it's my preferred look. ;)
@govtgoth I can be easily spotted as the chubby middle-aged guy w full leg tats. Also full sleeves but those oft covered on cold mornings.
@govtgoth Yup, I do. If you think you've seen me you probably have.
@govtgoth In the mall car park, by Toyworld, on Gothic St. seriously.
@govtgoth Marieka's in Jville always reasonable.
@BR3NDA Wade-Giles eh. I'm assuming it's "wo bu zhidao..." ("I don't know...")?
@Becs yup. And very smelly.
Entire family now stuffed & sunburnt after trip to Cape Kidnappers gannet colony.
@Becs they don't live in colonies, sadly.

A whole bloody load of gannets.
#gannetcolonynz #gannetcolony #birding #gannet #birds #nzbirds… https://t.co/IB8p5DuOmZ

Suspicious gannet.
"You looking at my bird, mate?"

Righto. Off to see gannets.
@BR3NDA @GrumpyYetAmusin @ebryantnz triangles and chevrons, yup.
@GrumpyYetAmusin @ebryantnz nah, I just go in and say "let's fill out this sleeve a bit eh".
@GrumpyYetAmusin @ebryantnz to be fair, my tattoos are fairly abstract patterns, so there could be some coded meaning I suppose.
@hadyngreen I have yet to meet a tattooist who liked them.
@hadyngreen I blame the tattoo reality shows.
@GrumpyYetAmusin I explained that they meant that I can sit still and had cash. He seemed unimpressed.
I hear Wellington is having bad weather. I spent the day doing waterslides.
Bloke at Splash Planet seemed personally affronted that my tattoos don't have any meaning. "Isn't it your Viking heritage?" he asked. Nope.
View from the top. #napier #aotearoa #nz #hawkesbay #summer @ Napier, New Zealand https://t.co/Rx1Ub5fNL9

Paper wasps inside a pipe.

@FallenRedNinja my wife, the full-bore violinist. 🤘🏽🤘🏽🤘🏽
At the stage of a visit to the in-laws where the spare violin comes out. #folkmusic

"Super-compact chainsets: the next big thing for road cyclists?" - I've been using a CX 46/34, this is a good trend. https://t.co/mdhvogrX1U
So @RNZConcert marked the occasion by playing Tom Lehrer's "We Will All Go Together When We Go".
@dimsie THIS HAS HAPPENED TO MY IN-LAWS TOO. it's an epidemic in West Auckland!
At Mission Bay. @ Mission Bay Beach https://t.co/NvNwvIfiWF
@mairesmith have knocked 50% of those offf today so far. 😊
@hroethgar So I hear... unfortunately we're just here for a day to break the trip to Akl. Might hit It on the way back.
@kw217 @BBCRadio4 Snap. Slight wobble over the poetry question but remembered it right.
Have stayed in Taupo a lot over the past decade or so. Never went to the AC Baths until today. What a mug.
Holidays, day 2: trip to the Warehouse to replace the stuff the kids forgot to bring (hats, jandals).
@DubiousStephen Catchphrase: "Typical, isn't it? Tch."
@DubiousStephen This is basically a capsule summary of the English national character.
Of course, I bring them inside for winter.
That's not a joke, btw: I'm currently growing highland Nepenthes fr Malaysia outside in Johnsonville, and they're thriving.
For people thinking you can't grow pitcher plants outside, Wellington has the same climate as Mt Kinabalu today.
At the stage of this gig where the violinists are outnumbering the dancers.
@LewSOS Solid Steel Radio Show has done a lot of 20th anniversary mixes recently: Endtroducing, Odelay, Paul's Boutique, etc.
I explain things, badly. https://t.co/gTF8ZNKrZ2
@LewSOS @buzzandhum I could see this as getting competitive: "we've left 12 bugs, let's see if they get them all this time!"
@LewSOS @buzzandhum Surely the SS go through and debug the rooms prior to the POTUS staying, then FSB puts the bugs back after?
@j20r chapeau!
@wizzyrea @librarykris Yeah, we thought it was Douglas Adams meets the Coen Brothers.
@librarykris Beats me, but have you seen Dirk Gently's Holistic Detective Agency?
@VinLew You can walk to whatever you need, there's good transport into town, it's OK for cycle commuting, good schools. Works for us.
@dimsie @lyndonhood It's like when you find that the use of "canon" in literature dates back to OG Sherlock Holmes fanfic from 19/20thC.
@LewSOS @dimsie I've got bad news for you, Lew
@LewSOS @dimsie Tagline from Dreamworks' upcoming adaptation of the Captain Ubderpants books, presumably
@Artandmylife There's a channel on Youtuvbe with every episode of Blake's Seven.
Showing kids classic Dr Who. The Ark in Space terrified 9yo, up until she realised the monster was literally made of bubble wrap.
Alternate link on Soundcloud: https://t.co/S0TotH99jQ #klf #liedownonthefloorandkeepcalm

KLF revival an excellent reason to play this: https://t.co/0jThlLXga2 - 70+ mins of full-bore faux-live madness!
(Not actually live)
@buzzandhum Everybody lie down on the floor and keep calm.
@BR3NDA Cameras don't pick up wind.
I listen to 1 ambient drone track. Apple music: You like the genre 'Experimental'; here are recordings of cinderblocks breaking and shrieks
@saniac Nasty. Do you have any IP tracking on comments?
News Year, day 5. https://t.co/SuGBWikmCT
@BR3NDA One power co is offering $500 off vouchers for ebikes.
Want your faith in humanity restored? Fix a puncture outside the railway station during rush hour. Lost count of the offers of help.
Achieved something I'd thought was impossible: snapped a @parktool tyre lever.
@dubh I really enjoyed this article about the counterfeiting: https://t.co/2UAeBqZGXw
@dubh yeah apparently they knock off spircycle ones are pretty shit. The spring dies after about three days and then they don't work at all.
Willing to bet I'm one of the few people happy about a gale force sourtherly hitting. #tailwind
@kathsprout Hey hey someone made https://t.co/xVKy1DbT1m...
I appear to have accidentally set my watch to French.
@GamesterAtLarge There's some kind of Morris pub crawl happening today.
@MeganWegan Waterfront isn't a euphemism there, either.
@MeganWegan Not on the waterfront it wasn't.
@jackelder To clarify: both on same bike, girl sitting on the handlebars at the front a la how we used to give mates lifts when we were kids
Cheered me up no end. Casual cycling, go!
#WellyHagen moment: saw a couple riding around the waterfront this morn, helmetless, casual dress, woman sitting on the guy's handlebars.
Got a @Spurcycle bell for Xmas and it's absolutely incredible. Genuinely astonished by volume, tone, and sustain. Recommended, if pricey.
In retrospect, I probably could have guessed that Ferris wheel was an eponym.
@chetibby not sure if it's a morning thing, should be open this arvo apparently. Still tho
@chetibby It's a rainy morning in the summer holidays, genuinely gobsmacked at the lack of provision for kids.
@WgtnCC Staff said they didn't care, and we should take them to a different pool. This is simply not good enough.
@chetibby Totally closed for lane swimming this morning - nowhere in the main pool for kids. Under 5s have the side room, nothing for older.
Even worse when the online calendar says that there will be two swimming lanes, not that the entire pool will be taken up with lane swimming
Also remarkably unimpressed at rude/dismissive attitude of staff at Keith Spry pool when this was pointed out.
Astonishing: on a public hol, in the middle of the summer hols, @wgtncc thinks it's ok to have nowhere for kids to swim in a public pool.
@WgtnCC Especially when the online calendar for today says that only 2 lanes will be set up: https://t.co/080VpRoCXx
@WgtnCC Staff at pool rude and dismissive when this was pointed out. It's the summer holidays - surely kids should be able to swim?
@WgtnCC Very poor treatment at Keith Spry pool this morning- totally taken up w lane swimming, nowhere for kids to swim.
At least, that's what I tell myself every time I have to cycle to work in the rain. #wetfeet
The weather outside always looks worse than it is when you're inside, warm, and dry. Once you get out in it, it's never as bad as you think.
My day in 3 pictures, 3: kittens. About 3w old. https://t.co/dD2gMTpmf9
My day in 3 pictures, 2: teacup bunny. 8 days old. https://t.co/2umVOiLaaX
My day in 3 pictures, 1: surprise cupcakes made by our 9yo while we slept in. @ Wellington, New… https://t.co/4tL92dFKKk
Happy New Year, all. Due to time zones, I'm sitting by the side of a municipal swimming pool while my UK mates get bevvied. Funny old world.
